intro: Hieracium codesianum, commonly known as the Codesia hawkweed, is a perennial flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grasslands and open woodlands, thriving in well-drained soils. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while the flowers are yellow and arranged in a flat-topped inflorescence. It plays a role in supporting local pollinators and is often found in disturbed habitats.
